net.xuset.objectIO.markupMsg

Class MarkupMsg

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.markupMsg.MarkupMsg
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupNetMsg

    public class MarkupMsg
extends java.lang.Object
    A MarkupMsg object is used to transfer data in a protocol independent way between connections. A MarkupMsg has a name and content field, it can have attributes, and it can nest other MarkupMsg objects.

    A good example of how a MarkupMsg object is used is with the TcpCon connection. When sendMsg(MarkupMsg) is called on the connection, the connection takes the supplied message and converts it into a byte array using a MsgParser. The byte array is sent through the sockets OutputStream and is converted back into a MarkupMsg object on the other side.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Connection

      • getNested

        public MarkupMsg getNested(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the message with the supplied name. If multiple messages have the same name, the first one in the list is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the message to return
        Returns:
        the message whose name equals the supplied name, or null if no message has the supplied name

      • getAttribute

        public MsgAttribute getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the attribute with the supplied name. If multiple attributes have the same name, the first one in the list is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the attribute to return
        Returns:
        the attribute whose name equals the supplied name, or null if no attribute has the supplied name.

      • setAttribute

        public MsgAttribute setAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Searches for an existing attribute with the supplied name and sets the attribute's value with supplied value. IF multiple attributes have the same name, the first one is used. If no attribute is found, a new attribute is created and added to the list with the supplied name and value.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the attribute
        value - new value of the attribute
        Returns:
        the message attribute found or created.

      • addAttribute

                java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a new attribute to the list even if the list already contains an attribute the supplied name.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the attribute to create
        value - the value of the new attribute
